meanings.definition: A white crystalline compound used as an insecticide.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sprayed carbaryl on the crops to protect them from bugs.
meanings.sent2: The carbaryl powder was effective in getting rid of the pests in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The ants threw a party when they heard about the carbaryl coming to crash it.
meanings.sent4: The carbaryl worked like a shield, keeping the insects away from the plants.
meanings.sent5: The smell of carbaryl lingered in the air, a sign that the bugs wouldn't be back soon.

meanings.definition: To treat with carbaryl to kill insects.
meanings.sent1: The gardener decided to carbaryl the rose bushes to get rid of the aphids.
meanings.sent2: She carbaryled the entire garden to ensure the pests were eliminated.
meanings.sent3: The insects were not happy when they found out they were going to be carbaryled.
meanings.sent4: Carbaryling the yard was like sending a clear message to the bugs: leave or else!
meanings.sent5: The act of carbaryling the plants was like waving a magic wand to banish the pests.
